docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Aug. 12--Twenty-eight steamers totaling 157,269 tons are tied up at five Argentine ports as a result of the war in Europe. Sixteen are Italian, four French, four Danish, three German and one Swedish.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Aug. 12--Twenty-eight steamers totaling 157,269 tons are tied up at five Argentine ports as a result of the war in Europe. Sixteen are Italian, four French, four Danish, three German and one Swedish.
docs.abstract: Survey of ships held up at Argentine ports because of Eur war

headline.main: WAR HOLDS 28 SHIPS IN ARGENTINE PORTS; Sixteen Italian, Three German Vessels Among Those Tied Up on Account of War LINER FORMOSE IS THERE French Vessel's Pursuit by the Graf Spee Led to Naval Battle Off Uruguay

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14--Loss of overseas trade by Italy was the principal economic factor in the first month of that country's participation in the European war, James W. Young, director of the Bureau of Foreign and Domestic Commerce, reported today in...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14--Loss of overseas trade by Italy was the principal economic factor in the first month of that country's participation in the European war, James W. Young, director of the Bureau of Foreign and Domestic Commerce, reported today in a general summary of foreign trade data.

headline.main: 3 NATIONS TIGHTEN ECONOMIC CONTROL; Italy, Losing Overseas Trade, Extends Price, Uses Curbs, Commerce Dept. Finds JAPAN PLANS LIKE MOVES And United Kingdom Outlines Its Regulations in Field More Fully

docs.snippet: BOGOTA, Colombia, Aug. 17-- Just as few persons believed that democracy with its liberties of person, press, speech and self-government could disappear overnight from its Old World strongholds in Denmark, Norway, the Netherlands, Belgium and France,...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOGOTA, Colombia, Aug. 17-- Just as few persons believed that democracy with its liberties of person, press, speech and self-government could disappear overnight from its Old World strongholds in Denmark, Norway, the Netherlands, Belgium and France, so it seems incredible to many here that a fifth column could succeed in Colombia.
docs.abstract: 17 dismissed Scadta employes leave Colombia with Japanese visas, bound for Germany by way of Siberia
